config.question: One of the first acts of the new Republican Congress was to repeal the Judiciary Act of 1801, abolishing the __________.

answer_3.response: In January 1802, Jefferson’s congressional allies called for repeal of the Judiciary Act. In public debate, they studiously avoided the obvious political issue. The new circuit courts should be closed not only because they were staffed by Federalists but also because they were needlessly expensive. The judges did not hear enough cases to warrant continuance.
